The fort of the Palamidi, which has been preserved in excellent condition, is one of the greatest achievements of Venetian fortification architecture.
The fort on the sea, which has remained known by its Turkish name Bourtzi, meaning tower, has become Nafplion\'s trademark.This small island is in the middle of the city's harbour.

Syndagma Square, the most historic square in Nauplion, comprises the centre of the city.The square was once home to the residences of many of the great fighters of the Greek revolution, such as Nikitaras and Theodoros Kolokotronis.
This square takes its name from the figure who above all others is synonymous with the history of the city: Ioannis Kapodistrias, the first governor of the modern Greek state.
